website_summaries.verdict: This is an inexpensive option for a quality tablet, making it the perfect choice for kids, teens, or someone looking for a basic model.
pros: Lightweight design makes it perfect those on-the-go
External charging light is a useful indication of battery status
Decent battery life – between 6 and 8 hours after full charge
Display is surprisingly clear and vibrant for a budget-level tablet
cons: Smaller screen may be tough for those with big hands to use

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this hunk of junk should be 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: Hated it. Slow - like have to wait for the keyboard to pop up ad not just a second or two. Forever for pages to load. Failure to load 35% of the time. Browser shuts down multiple times daily - worse than original silk browser. I feel like I'm using a tablet from 10 years ago instead of a brand new one. Spend the extra 100 - 300$$ to avoid this complete and utter disaster of a tablet. No wonder my company switched to Dell! Wow additional note trying to Google if the screen comes up the second you touch it to scroll it blacks out. Geez
customer_reviews.author: MsHellfire

customer_reviews.title: Not a good tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tablet mostly because it was on the cheaper side, but it's not really a good tablet. The main issues are: 1) Wifi is highly unreliable. The software is really buggy and you have to disable certain settings for the wifi to stay on for more than ~5 minutes. 2) It's not a very powerful tablet (CPU-wise). Even browsing the internet is taxing and webpages render very slowly. In general, every action on the tablet feels sluggish / laggy.
customer_reviews.author: Sudocloud

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for kids!
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet for my 8 year old, she is able to use it for Netflix, games and music. It does lag at times but I think that may be mostly our WiFi connection and not an issue with the tablet. The screen is responsive and clear. I think it’s a great, reasonably priced tablet for kids. I think it would work well as an e-reader, listening to music and browsing the web as well.
customer_reviews.author: N. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: A nice sized tablet with problems
customer_reviews.text: While the tablet did have a nice screen with bright video, I couldn't stick with it as several of the apps kept failing. After reboot, it wasn't long until I kept getting pop-up notifications that one or the other had failed, They were automatically restarted, but they would fail again shortly. It became a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: I really like it my second one
customer_reviews.text: I really like it my second one. Screen is bright and clear. The problem is they don’t last long. I haven’t had it 10 months yet and it’s broken. It’s my third one. It’s nice while it lasts but I am not buying a 4th one. It’s very upsetting
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Karakatsanis

customer_reviews.title: Slow to respond.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely worth what you pay. It's a little disappointing considering Lenovo is a decent computer company. The touch is really slow to repond, the tablet itself is slow to start, the batter dies really fast and takes forever to charge. But like I said it serves it's purpose and I'm not using it for things that require fast reaction time. It's effective. If you need something with more power or longer batter life look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Meggera

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet but keeps dropping WiFi connection
customer_reviews.text: I received the tablet and it connected to the router but there was no internet connection. I got a replacement and this one connects but keeps disconnecting every day. Turning the WiFi off and on from settings does not work, you have to restart the tablet. None of my other tables have this issue, so it’s nlt my network. The tablet is nice and small but just has problems staying connected to the WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Mayer

customer_reviews.title: I believe it would be a great idea to display the actual size when advertising your tablets. And Dolby sound!
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten the larger Lenovo tablet with Dolby sound a couple of years ago. It was around 80 bucks at Walfart. They no longer carry them. Although the size of this is much smaller, I couldn't afford the extra 40 bucks to get the same as I had previously. I prefer Lenovo over the Samsung Galaxy, from Walfart, which I returned. I was truly wanting the 8+ inch Lenovo.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the money. Not the greatest tablet, but it does what I needed which it serves as an employee time clock for a small business. I was able to lock the main screen to show only the clock in and out website for ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: amfbiz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked this device does not have 5G wifi support. I have to drop this to a one star. The wifi (only 2.4G band available) keeps dropping connection or can't connect at all. I have two other tablets and an iphone that has no such problems. The bluetooth also takes forever to connect. Sometimes I have drop the device and go through the pairing process. This is a terrible device.
customer_reviews.author: Hsu

customer_reviews.title: If you buy it, dont plan on trying to return it...
customer_reviews.text: Tablet was OK, but didn't work for my needs, so I returned it.... 2 months has gone by, and I still haven't seen my refund, and my status of Return requested hasn't changed, even though the tablet was returned and delivered. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Delaney

customer_reviews.title: So underpowered that it is useless.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet because it is one of the few Android tablets that seemed to support later versions. Boy was I wrong! The tablet is so underpowered that after running 2 apps, the tablet keeps crashing. The response is so slow that it is not usable at all. Rebooting helps for a few minutes, but then we are back to the slowest tablet I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: eddy Gorsuch

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed in the sluggish operating system of this device. I typically like this brand.
customer_reviews.author: AmaKay

customer_reviews.title: Great basic tablet
customer_reviews.text: It's a great basic tablet. Needs more ram. But the person we gave this to doesn't use it much, just to download publications for the JW library App
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S

customer_reviews.title: WIFI connection is interrupted
customer_reviews.text: My worst tablet experience. the WIFI connection is constantly interrupted and internet access is lost
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tablet! Does everything I need it to do. Good battery life, crisp screen, and so far works with all of my desired apps.
customer_reviews.author: WNelson

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: One thing I wanted it for-- to take pictures. Won't let you access them after you take them.
customer_reviews.author: Greenbarn

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the convenient size my wife wanted. Simular to the Nexus 7 we have. It is not a power house but does run the apps and little games she likes well. Happy with product. Only complaint is that I have not been able to find a case/cover for it. I bought one that was for the Lenovo Tab3 7 Essential hoping it would work with UT it was a little big. Anyone know of one?
customer_reviews.author: PJohn

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a tablet to give away for free to ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a tablet to give away for free to new signup customers for my business. This in-expensive and reliable tablet for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: i like it. its fast
customer_reviews.text: i like it. its fast. I recommend it. I ordered it same day shipping it came the next day. its good for a 80 dollars
customer_reviews.author: katya

customer_reviews.title: Okay tab...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly Okay tablet. I purchased it for a one use cause and it was fairly responsive and useful. I still don't recommend using it for anything critical because the Chinese Government probably has a backdoor into their devices but if you are sending it on a one way trip to its doom then it is actually pretty darn good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: DEAD ON ARRIVAL!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Tablet to replace a 2013 Google Nexus 7 that had seen ben awesome. The tablet arrived with no charge on battery.. I plugged it in and left it over night. The tablet still would turn on .. I contacted Lenova support without any help. I am an adult and was going to use it primarily to surf. No gaming. Thought it would be the perfect little tablet. It was DEAD ON ARRIVAL. Had to pay to have it shipped back while only having it less than 24 hours. The screen would never light up. No sound. Would not recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Alan George

customer_reviews.title: Calendar problem
customer_reviews.text: The device is fatally flawed for my purposes because it will not coordinate with a corporate calendar unless that calendar is linked to Google's, which violates security protocols.
customer_reviews.author: Bennu

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Don't need anything expensive this Lenovo tab is perfect! It does the same as samsung or Ipad much better than Ipad always. :)
customer_reviews.author: EdanRyE

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The good: I bought two for my kids. One lasted 5 months and the screen died. The ither one is still working. The bad: Lenovo's customer service. After 20 days at Lenovos repair center (it is under warranty) no one really knows when they will repair it. They say a date but time goes by and nothing happens. I would never, ever buy this tablet or brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeng

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect iPad mini performance for 80 bucks
customer_reviews.text: I've read a lot of reviews, and my impression is that people think they will get an iPad mini performance for 80 dollars. Make no mistake; this is an excellent product for the price. Yes, I had issues with the wifi, but I solved once I put the tablet it airport mode (turning off Bluetooth). My primary use is for reading books and my RSS feed. I also watch youtube videos and works great. I wouldn't play games on this one because my experience will be clumsy.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Lepesqueur

customer_reviews.title: problems to charge
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is a bit slow in preforming task but it does do what it was bought for (entertainment). I would have been able to overlook the slow processing speed if this device were not otherwise problematic. It refuses to charge most days and when it does charge it take 8-10+ hours to do so. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Martin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a previous Lenovo 7 inch tablet that was bulletproof. This one is pure junk multiple software problems apps crash cannot hold a wifi signal. Need to reboot to connect to wifi. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The screen is terrible for the eyes
customer_reviews.text: I bought it from a local store in my country, it has a very bad screen for the eyes, the sound quality is not good. Not good for any use except radio with connected speakers.
customer_reviews.author: poioq

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cheap Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap tablet my family uses to just watch Netflix and browse the web. It is a little on the slow side response-wise and I still haven't quite figured out how to load videos on it to watch from the native video player, but it gets the job done. Has decent on-board memory, so my kids can download things to watch on a road trip when we don't have wi-fi. The battery life is not great, but charges relatively quickly. For the price, it does exactly what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Graham

customer_reviews.title: Slow.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good looking tablet but it is very very slow even for simple process, like reading a pdf. It is what you get for that price I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: A decent little tablet. The resolution is adequate for watching shows, and looking at photos. The camera on this is only 2 megapixels so I wouldn't recommend it for photography. It's fine for the occasional selfie for posting to social media, but not for high quality photography. My kids were able to download a few games and it worked well for them. Netflix, and Prime videos worked well. For the price, this certainly is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bird

customer_reviews.title: False advertising, 1GB of ram only
customer_reviews.text: This tablet only has 1GB of ram. The only thing "16GB" is the flash storage. 1GB = 2010 slow. It won't be practical to multitask. The 2017 Kindle HD 8 has 1.5GB of ram and it's already obsolete before it ships.
customer_reviews.author: bigblue

customer_reviews.title: A good smaller tablet for a good price
customer_reviews.text: A good smaller tablet for a good price! Our kids have trashed their kindle fire for kids (both broke the charging ports and warranty ran out) and this is a good replacement. There was a little initial lag in the OS I think due to initial background downloads that had me thinking it might be critically underpowered. However that cleared up and it became a standard droid tablet. Works just fine for kid apps, netflix and general browsing. As others have mentioned the camera isn't great, use your phone instead. :D All told this is a good small form factor tablet that won't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Bigslacker

customer_reviews.title: Don't fall for the low price point.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is so slow that it is unusable. You can't use it to play games or even simple news apps like Flipbook without it crashing all the time. By just turning the device on you are already using over 80% of the devices resources.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Bates
